item.title: Scattered
item.description:
Scattered
By Twilight Courier

Looking into the origins of the subculture
She had lost her soul long ago to their marketing schemes
And noticing her hips as her dress fell everywhere but off
He then withdrew into the hermitage to eat a healthy diet of oats and fungus
But not before committing to spectacular changes
That would bring the evocation of gentle strings
Screaming
Like a noxious renegade
Shifting gears
To try and deal with the pandemic blues
Until his second departure would mean leaving once more

item.title: Summer's End Storm
item.description:
Summer's End Storm
Twilight Courier

the city is not as it used to be
a cowardly man flees during the storm
his dog moves frantically, but certainly with purpose to find the coward who had abandoned him

and from the bridge one of the most beautiful views of the hills
and from the bushes comes a vagrant stumbling from the recent injection
and from the fallen trees the path is blocked

the
thunder booms
in realization

item.title: When I Set Off I Was A Troubled Man
item.description:
When I Set Off I Was A Troubled Man
Twilight Courier

When I set off I was a troubled man
And I only returned with different troubles

I realized the blight of compassion dying
That staying would take my soul
And in preservation of empathy
I left once again, quickly and without regret
